instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU_REG: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU_REG? PPVCORE_S0_CPU_REG is a single phase of CPU VCORE before it is combined into PPVCORE_S0_CPU .
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_AXG_REG: What is PPVCORE_S0_AXG_REG? PPVCORE_S0_AXG_REG Is a single phase of CPU VCORE for the graphics processor integrated into the CPU before it is combined into one PPVCORE_S0_AXG rail.

threads.title: 820 3023 - No fan Spin
threads.message:
Hey, 

working on board 820 3023, <TRANSISTOR>Q9425</TRANSISTOR> has been touched i remove and replace for a new one! no liquid damage and no corrosion points! 

when i plug the charger fan don't work, but the board looks like it's working. 

i have a working board for another repair and the only voltages missing is: =<SIGNAL>PPDDR_S3_REG</SIGNAL>, =<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU_REG</SIGNAL>, =<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_AXG_REG</SIGNAL>.

i compare in diode mode l7330 to a good work board and have the same result 0.195v. 

i compere some points in diode mode and l7630 (=PPCPUVCCIO_S0_REG) i have 0v, in resistance mode 2 ohm. a working board have 0.016v , 25ohm!  the curios when i plug the charger i have 1.06V. 


suggestions?? cpu dead??

threads.title: 820 3023 - No fan Spin
threads.message: 2 Ohm on VCCIO is pretty sure a shorted CPU. CPU will probably get pretty toasty as well right now.
